content:
Both Lisbon and Porto are great destinations in Portugal, and both have their own unique charm and attractions. However, if you only have three full days for your trip, I would recommend visiting Lisbon. Here's why:

1. Lisbon is the capital city of Portugal and has a wider range of things to see and do. It has many historical sites, museums, and cultural attractions, such as the Belem Tower, the Jeronimos Monastery, and the National Museum of Ancient Art.
2. Lisbon has a vibrant nightlife, with many bars, restaurants, and clubs, especially in the Bairro Alto neighborhood.
3. Lisbon is also located near several day-trip destinations, such as Sintra, Cascais, and the beaches of the Costa da Caparica.
4. Porto is a beautiful city and has a lot to offer, but it is smaller than Lisbon and can be explored in less time.

Overall, if you only have three days for your trip to Portugal, Lisbon offers more activities and attractions to fill your time.
